column4: Hello, I am have a question.  Attempting to install ubuntu 10.10 on top of win7, however ubuntu installer only see's my 2nd hard drive (D: in windows)  I partitioned my first drive in windows (C:) to have free unpartitioned space, however it does not show up in the ubuntu installer.  Any ideas?  Thanks for any input
You might want to try using the "manual" partitioning instead - that allows you to specify your target(s)...
I go through the manual partitioning instead, however the drive does not appear there?  Is it possible that win7 wrote MBR to the 2nd drive and install itself on the 1st?
I go through the manual partitioning instead, however the drive does not appear there?  Is it possible that win7 wrote MBR to the 2nd drive and install itself on the 1st?
